page.title: 06HOUSING IN THE OAKLEY AREA
page.content: In the Oakley area most people live in a house rather than a flat.The majority are rented from the{Council or the{Scottish Special Housing {Association.}Most of the houses are semi-detached,but others are detached or terraced.{Privately owned}houses are mostly in Comrie which have been built in the last 9 years by a local builder. Few people have an{attached garage}or have built an{extension}and these tend to be in Comrie.20% have{double {glazing.}The houses in Oakley and Blairhall,the two other villages,are mostly between{20 and 50}years old. 45% of the houses are heated by coal,the next most popular fuel being gas.Most houses are 2-4 appartments.
